How to Install adcli on debian

  • Home
  • debian
  • adcli

Today in this tutorial, I’ll show you how you can install adcli on debian with and without using the command line.

Introduction

Installing adcli on debian is very easy. And with the help of this tutorial, you will be able to easily install, update and uninstall adcli in just a few steps.

In this tutorial I’ll show you four methods to install adcli, the methods are using apt, apt-get, aptitude, and synaptic. All these methods require you to have an active and stable internet connection and sudo permission.

Install adcli Using apt

To install adcli in debian using apt, you will need to run the apt update command first to get the updated list of packages from the repositories.

Copy the command given below and paste it in the command line, then press enter. If you are using the sudo command for the first time then you might also need to enter your root password.

sudo apt update

After you have updated the package list using apt, you can now install adcli using the apt install command. To do that use the command given below.

sudo apt -y install adcli

The installation of adcli might take a little bit of time depending upon your internet connection and machine configuration.

Install adcli Using apt-get

To install adcli using apt-get in debian, you will need to first update the package list using the apt-get update command. Copy, paste, and enter the command given below in the command line.

sudo apt-get update

After updating the package lists, use the apt-get install command given below to install adcli.

sudo apt-get -y install adcli

Install adcli Using Synaptic

To install adcli using Synaptic you will need to first install Synaptic, you can do that by following the instructions from here. After installing synaptic follow the steps below to install adcli on your debian using Synaptic.

You can open synaptic by clicking on the menu icon then searching for synaptic or you can open the command line and enter the command given below –

sudo synaptic

After synaptic opens, click on the search icon and search for adcli. This will display the adcli package in the package window, now to install adcli, click on the checkbox that is on the left side.

Then click on Mark for Installation, this will select the adcli package for installation, now to install it click on the Apply button, you will get a summary window where click on the apply button again to start the download of adcli.

If the download and installation are successful then the checkmark option will turn green.

Install adcli Using aptitude

To install adcli on debian using aptitude, you will need to first install Aptitude in your debian. To install Aptitude follow the instructions here. Once you have aptitude installed proceed to the installation of adcli.

Now you will need to first update your package lists from the repositories, use the apt update command for that, after that update the package list of aptitude using the aptitude update command.

sudo apt update sudo aptitude update

After updating the package list of aptitude, install adcli using the command aptitude install adcli.

sudo aptitude -y install adcli

How to Upgrade adcli on debian

If you want to upgrade the adcli package on your debian to its latest version then here’s how you can do that using apt, apt-get, aptitude, and synaptic.

Upgrade adcli using Apt & Apt-get

To upgrade adcli to its latest version using apt or apt-get, you will need to open the terminal then run the sudo apt update command to update the package list, after that copy and paste the commands given below to upgrade adcli.

sudo apt install --only-upgrade adcli sudo apt-get install --only-upgrade adcli

Upgrade adcli using Aptitude

To upgrade adcli using aptitude you will need to again run the update command to update the package list, use command sudo aptitude update to do that. After that run the command given below to upgrade adcli.

sudo aptitude -y full-upgrade adcli

Upgrade adcli using Synaptic

To upgrade adcli using synaptic open synaptic using the command sudo synaptic or by going to the menu and searching for synaptic.

In synaptic click on the reload button, this will look for updates. After that you will need to search for adcli, now right-click adcli, and click on the mark for upgrade option.

Now to upgrade adcli just click on the apply button, then click on the apply button again in the summary screen.

How To Uninstall adcli on debian

If you want to remove and uninstall adcli from your debian then here’s how you can do that. To remove just adcli, you can use the command that is given below, copy the command, paste it in the command line then press enter.

sudo apt remove adcli

Remove related packages, dependencies & configuration files of adcli

To remove all the related packages, dependencies and configuration files of adcli you can use the command given below.

sudo apt -y purge adcli

Remove adcli using Synaptic Package Manager

You can also uninstall adcli using the synaptic package manager, first open synaptic using the command sudo synaptic or search and open it directly.

After that in synaptic search for adcli, right-click the adcli package and click on the Mark for Complete Removal option. Now to uninstall adcli click on the apply button then in summary click on apply again.

Conclusion

That is how you can install adcli on debian using the command line or using the synaptic package manager. I also showed you how you can uninstall and upgrade adcli using the command line or using the synaptic package manager.

If you need any help regarding the installation of adcli then send me a mail at netmikoblog@gmail.com, thank you.
